intro: Batrachium mongolicum, commonly known as the Mongolian batrachium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Mongolia and northern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. The plant is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in steppe and semi-desert environments.
